availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lafayette North (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer, captain and lieutenant colonel (U.S.A.))

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Catherine Robinson North in Bath County, Kentucky, on February 21, 1851. Father of James William North, Percilla North, Mary North, Daniel Boonk North, and Martha North. Farmer in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Served in the 24th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as captain from December 31, 1861 to October 24, 1863. Served in the 24th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as lieutenant colonel from October 24, 1863 to January 31, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 2, p. 23B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 186.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Mudlick, p. 28A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film 000273005.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0370.
